abstract: Michael Powell Sports of the Times column notes that although New England Patriots coach Bill Belichick and quarterback Tom Brady both deny any knowledge of how or why team had 11 underinflated footballs at AFC championship game, Brady is more friendly and forthcoming when dealing with press; NFL investigators have been slow to respond to situation.
lead_paragraph: Coach Bill Belichick and quarterback Tom Brady both said they were utterly baffled as to how the Patriots came into possession of 11 underinflated footballs for the A.F.C. championship game.
snippet: Coach Bill Belichick and quarterback Tom Brady both said they were utterly baffled as to how the Patriots came into possession of 11 underinflated footballs for the A.F.C. championship game.

headline.main: Nope. No Idea. Not Me. Next.
headline.seo: Tom Brady and Bill Belichick United in Not Knowing in New England
headline.print_headline: Nope. No Idea. Not Me. Next.
